instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: this board only turns on smc bypass mode, could you help me by telling me where to start measuring for this damage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
Can you get it into macOS in SMC bypass?

There must be a problem related with some SMC sensor.
Ceck first <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
Can you get it into macOS in SMC bypass? yes
<SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage=3.3v
when plugged in charger it restarts constant fan; without giving video.
just power on with video and enter system bypass mode and fan rotate normal

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
Strange, fan should spin to max in SMC bypass mode.

Check I/VSENSE sensors output on pages 49 & 50.
Run HWMonitor, if possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
excuse me in bybass mode fan spin to max
these are measurements when board fan restarts constantly

<SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL>=2.1 y baja 0 si se mantiene ciclicamente
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL>=2.8 y baja 2.7 ciclo
<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_VSENSE</SIGNAL>=1.16 y baja 0 ciclo
<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_ISENSE</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_GFX_VSENSE</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_GFX_ISENSE</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_CPUVCCIO_ISENSE</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_HI_ISENSE</SIGNAL>=0.67 y baja 0.16 ciclo
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>=0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_OTHER_HI_ISENSE</SIGNAL>=0.80 se mantiene asi ciclo
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL>=0.30 se mantiene asi ciclo

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
Any history available?

You should try reballing SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: I already did smc reballing, this problem persists fan restarts constantly, Â¿change the smc? no story available

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: change smc it worked fine for a while, then it didn't turn on again, it only turns on bypass mode but without video. It is possible that the battery is causing it or another component

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: Reflow it; be sure to get good solders.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: I did reflow and it did not work, I am using solder paste and flux of not high quality. Do you think it has to do? do I reballing smc with a high quality solder paste?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: If machine worked correctly after you've replaced SMC, then I suspect bad solders now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: ok, What brand of solder paste and flux do you use?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: I use quality flux, ECOFREC TF 49, but cheap chinese solder paste.
